title: go-coder: AST-driven Go coding agent
description:
Go library that turns an LLM into a coding agent. Takes a natural language prompt, assembles repository context, sends it to AWS Bedrock, parses the response into file edits (AST mutation for Go, text search/replace for others), applies edits, verifies with go build/test, and retries on failure.

Public API: Coder interface with Run(ctx, prompt) method in pkg/coder/.
Caller: mage-claude-orchestrator imports this library.

## Documentation (Complete)
- VISION.md, ARCHITECTURE.md, road-map.yaml
- 9 PRDs (prd001-prd009)
- 8 use cases (rel01.0-rel07.0)
- 8 test suites

## Implementation Phases
- 01.0: AST Foundation (parser, symbol table, scanner)
- 01.1: AST Mutation (function replacement, struct modification, imports)
- 02.0: Edit Format and Text Edits
- 03.0: LLM Integration (AWS Bedrock)
- 04.0: Feedback Loop (compiler, test runner, retry)
- 05.0: Repository Map (tree-sitter, PageRank)
- 06.0: Git Integration
- 07.0: CLI and Orchestrator Integration

title: Release 01.0: AST Foundation (parser, symbol table, scanner)
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md § File Scanner, AST Engine
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-ast-engine.yaml (R1: File Scanner, R2: Symbol Table)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-coder-interface.yaml (R5: Shared Types - Symbol, SymbolKind)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.0-uc001-parse-and-index.yaml
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.0-uc001-parse-and-index.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/symbol.go (create) - Symbol, SymbolKind types
- internal/ast/scanner.go (create) - ScanDir with worker pool
- internal/ast/parser.go (create) - Go AST parsing, symbol extraction
- internal/ast/symboltable.go (create) - Symbol table with lookup methods
- internal/ast/scanner_test.go (create)
- internal/ast/parser_test.go (create)
- internal/ast/symboltable_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Implement file scanner using filepath.WalkDir with .gitignore support
- Worker pool of goroutines for parallel Go file parsing
- Parse Go files into ast.File using go/parser with ParseComments
- Extract symbols: functions, structs, interfaces, methods, variables
- Build symbol table with lookup by name, by file, by kind
- Symbol type with Name, Kind, File, Line, Signature fields

## Design Decisions
- Use go/parser and go/ast from stdlib (no tree-sitter for Go files)
- Worker pool bounded by runtime.NumCPU()
- Symbol table is an in-memory map, rebuilt on each Run invocation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ScanDir walks repository respecting .gitignore
- [ ] Parser extracts all symbol kinds from Go source
- [ ] Symbol table supports lookup by name, file, and kind
- [ ] Tests pass for all operations per test suite
- [ ] 300-700 LOC production code

title: Release 01.1: AST Mutation (function replacement, struct modification, imports)
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md § AST Engine (mutation operations)
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd002-ast-engine.yaml (R3: AST Mutation, R4: Write-back, R5: Comment Preservation)
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel01.1-uc001-mutate-function-body.yaml
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel01.1-uc001-mutate-function-body.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/ast/mutation.go (create) - ReplaceFunctionBody, AddFunction, RemoveFunction, ModifyStruct, AddImport, RemoveImport
- internal/ast/writer.go (create) - WriteFile with go/format and atomic write
- internal/ast/commentmap.go (create) - Comment preservation using ast.CommentMap
- internal/ast/mutation_test.go (create)
- internal/ast/writer_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- ReplaceFunctionBody: locate function by name, replace body AST nodes
- AddFunction/RemoveFunction: insert or remove function declarations
- ModifyStruct: add/remove/modify struct fields
- AddImport/RemoveImport: manage import declarations
- WriteFile: format mutated AST with go/format, atomic write to disk
- Comment preservation: use parser.ParseComments and ast.CommentMap

## Design Decisions
- Mutations operate on ast.File in memory, WriteFile serializes to disk
- Atomic write: write to temp file, rename (prevents partial writes)
- Comment preservation via ast.CommentMap re-attachment after mutation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Function body replacement produces valid Go output
- [ ] Import management adds/removes without duplicates
- [ ] Struct modification preserves existing fields and tags
- [ ] Comments survive mutation cycle
- [ ] Written files pass gofmt
- [ ] Tests pass per test suite

title: Release 02.0: Edit Format Parser and Text Edit Engine
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md § Edit Format Parser, Text Editor
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd003-edit-engine.yaml
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd004-edit-format.yaml
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel02.0-uc001-parse-and-apply-edits.yaml
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel02.0-uc001-parse-and-apply-edits.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/edit.go (create) - Edit struct, Applier interface
- internal/editformat/parser.go (create) - Parse SEARCH/REPLACE blocks from LLM output
- internal/editformat/router.go (create) - Route edits to AST engine or text editor
- internal/editor/editor.go (create) - Text-based search/replace with multi-stage matching
- internal/editor/matcher.go (create) - Exact, whitespace-normalized, fuzzy matching
- internal/editformat/parser_test.go (create)
- internal/editor/editor_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Parse SEARCH/REPLACE blocks delimited by <<<<<<< SEARCH / ======= / >>>>>>> REPLACE
- Parse whole-file blocks for file creation
- Multi-stage matching: exact, whitespace-normalized, fuzzy (threshold 0.8)
- Route .go files to AST engine, others to text editor
- Diagnostic output when match fails
- Applier interface shared between AST engine and text editor

## Design Decisions
- Edit format follows aider's proven search/replace block syntax
- Fuzzy matching uses sergi/go-diff for similarity scoring
- Router decides engine by file extension

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Parser extracts edits from multi-block LLM responses
- [ ] Text editor applies exact, whitespace-normalized, and fuzzy matches
- [ ] Router sends .go files to AST engine, others to text editor
- [ ] Failed matches produce diagnostic explaining expected vs found
- [ ] Tests pass per test suite

description:

- docs/specs/use-cases/rel03.0-uc001-bedrock-prompt-and-stream.yaml
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel03.0-uc001-bedrock-prompt-and-stream.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/message.go (create) - Message type for LLM communication
- internal/llm/client.go (create) - Bedrock client using ConverseStream API
- internal/llm/prompt.go (create) - Prompt construction (system + repo map + files + user prompt)
- internal/llm/templates/ (create) - Embedded prompt templates
- internal/llm/stream.go (create) - Token streaming via channel
- internal/llm/client_test.go (create)
- internal/llm/prompt_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Wrap AWS SDK for Go v2 bedrockruntime client
- Use ConverseStream API for streaming responses
- Construct message array: system prompt, repo map, file contents, user prompt
- Prompt templates embedded with go:embed
- Stream tokens through a channel
- Track token usage from API metadata
- Rate limit retry with exponential backoff
- Configurable model, region, timeout

## Design Decisions
- ConverseStream over InvokeModelWithResponseStream for structured messages
- Channel-based streaming (producer writes tokens, consumer reads)
- Templates embedded at compile time via go:embed

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Client sends prompt to Bedrock and streams response
- [ ] Token counting tracks input and output tokens
- [ ] Rate limit errors trigger exponential backoff retry
- [ ] Prompt construction includes all context sections
- [ ] Tests pass per test suite (with mocked Bedrock client)

title: Release 04.0: Feedback Loop (compiler, test runner, retry)
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md § Feedback Loop
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd007-feedback-loop.yaml
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel04.0-uc001-compile-test-retry.yaml
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel04.0-uc001-compile-test-retry.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/feedback/verify.go (create) - Run go build, go vet, test command
- internal/feedback/format.go (create) - Format errors into follow-up prompts
- internal/feedback/loop.go (create) - Retry loop up to MaxRetries
- internal/feedback/verify_test.go (create)
- internal/feedback/format_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Run go build and go vet on workspace after edits
- Run configurable test command (Config.TestCmd)
- Capture stdout and stderr from all commands
- Format errors with file context (5 lines above/below error location)
- Construct follow-up prompt showing errors and affected code
- Retry loop: edit, verify, retry up to MaxRetries (default 3)
- VerifyResult: BuildOK, VetOK, TestOK, Errors, TestOutput

## Design Decisions
- Commands executed via os/exec with context timeout
- Error formatting includes line numbers and surrounding code
- Retry loop is synchronous within the main pipeline

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] go build and go vet run and capture output
- [ ] Test command runs and captures output
- [ ] Errors formatted with surrounding code context
- [ ] Retry loop stops at MaxRetries or on success
- [ ] Tests pass per test suite

description:

## Files to Create/Modify
- pkg/types/repomap.go (create) - RepoMap type
- internal/repomap/extract.go (create) - Tree-sitter symbol extraction
- internal/repomap/graph.go (create) - Directed dependency graph
- internal/repomap/pagerank.go (create) - PageRank with personalization

- internal/repomap/extract_test.go (create)
- internal/repomap/pagerank_test.go (create)
- internal/repomap/render_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Extract symbols using smacker/go-tree-sitter across supported languages
- Build directed multigraph from symbol definitions and cross-file references
- PageRank with personalization (100x weight for relevant files, damping 0.85)
- Render top-ranked symbols within configurable token budget
- In-memory caching of extraction results

## Design Decisions
- Tree-sitter for multi-language support (not just Go)
- PageRank personalization biases toward prompt-mentioned and recently edited files
- Token budget controls map size to fit LLM context window

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tree-sitter extracts symbols from Go and common file types
- [ ] Dependency graph correctly models cross-file references
- [ ] PageRank ranks relevant files higher with personalization
- [ ] Rendered map stays within token budget
- [ ] Tests pass per test suite

title: Release 06.0: Git Integration (auto-commit, undo, dirty handling)
description:
## Required Reading
- docs/ARCHITECTURE.md § Git Integration
- docs/specs/product-requirements/prd008-git-integration.yaml
- docs/specs/use-cases/rel06.0-uc001-auto-commit-and-undo.yaml
- docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel06.0-uc001-auto-commit-and-undo.yaml

## Files to Create/Modify
- internal/git/git.go (create) - Git operations: commit, undo, dirty detection
- internal/git/commit.go (create) - Auto-commit with Co-Authored-By trailer
- internal/git/message.go (create) - Commit message generation from prompt keywords
- internal/git/git_test.go (create)
- internal/git/commit_test.go (create)

## Requirements
- Auto-commit after successful edits with Co-Authored-By trailer
- Detect dirty files and commit them separately before AI edits
- Commit message generation using conventional commits from prompt keywords
- Undo: reset --soft HEAD~1 identified by Co-Authored-By trailer
- Use go-git/go-git/v5 for git operations

## Design Decisions
- go-git library for programmatic git access (avoid shelling out)
- Co-Authored-By trailer identifies AI-generated commits for undo
- Dirty handling: separate pre-edit commit keeps user changes distinct

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Auto-commit creates commit with correct trailer after edits
- [ ] Dirty files committed separately before edit application
- [ ] Undo reverts last AI commit only (identified by trailer)
- [ ] Commit messages follow conventional commit format
- [ ] Tests pass per test suite
